@emmyagsmith @Global_CJP @StoneAtwine @Kasendwa @eversendapp Thank you Emma!!!!
@Spartakussug @StoneAtwine @eversendapp seeing your naughty from the sidelines.

@GoslinoJ @StoneAtwine @eversendapp Well, in this case, your point wasn't valid. 

Fundi Bots is not a for-profit. Grants and soft money keep us going because the communities we focus on would never be able to afford what we do unless it is subsidized/free. You may want to understand this context better.

@StoneAtwine @eversendapp Where are the 'bollocks' you speak about?  Name one.  If you disagree with advice or points made, let us discuss even debate, no problem.  I am happy to share startup research material with you, also in case you think am making things up for some weird reason.

@StoneAtwine @eversendapp Implementing good customer engagement and learning processes is a major asset to any business.  We could say much of the startup failures we see relate to weakness in this area, and a poor product/market fit.  What is your opinion?

@StoneAtwine @eversendapp Nobody is king of startups but luckily there is a good body of knowledge we can all use.  I met a Ugandan startup today that is re-considering its future just 9 months after attracting funding.  Business model not working. It happens.  Learned about understanding the customer.

@StoneAtwine @eversendapp Where have I been negative about Eversend?  Is for example asking questions when things are not clear a "negative".  We should welcome questions including from customers and be willing to answer them. As an idea, Eversend could also do so, and show how it solves problems.

@StoneAtwine @eversendapp I know a few kinds of trees and the fintech space, indeed, am also engaged in one.  I was making general observations but you appear to take things very personally, which is not necessary.  Try to take on board well-intentioned inputs, as you say, without argument.

@GoslinoJ @eversendapp @wizaj No. We are not on the same page. We are not on the same plane. Stop putting people down. I‚Äôm happy to listen to real talk, download the app and give me advice. I‚Äôm here to listen if you have a point.

@StoneAtwine @eversendapp Well in Uganda what is the score then?  Which 'startup' has been successful organically and attracted lots of smart investment money?  And who has exited?  Then we see where the 'experts' are.

@StoneAtwine @eversendapp It is not about who has built this or scaled that, it is about good practice, where customer-centric processes are at the core of the business. The startups that do better are those that make greater effort to understand their customers and apply lessons across the journey.

@StoneAtwine @eversendapp Who is banishing who?  You will get different feedback from different persons.  The one that really matters is from users.  That is what we are talking about.  Asking people about their experience with the app and service.

@StoneAtwine @eversendapp You need a systemised approach to customers and an open mind. Nobody cares about how 'difficult' it is for you, they want to see a good working solution to their problem.  I will download and become a 'user', but you need ways to extract and understand that experience.
@GoslinoJ @eversendapp Have you signed up @GoslinoJ?

@StoneAtwine @eversendapp You often hear terms like "amazing", "great" etc being used.  Then you ask these people to name one attribute of the product that makes it so "amazing"........and they can't tell you.  Because often they are not a user.  Hence my suggestions on how you can go about learning.
